program main

  implicit none

  integer :: N, i, j, len_s, found, vowel
  character(len=100) :: s(1000)
  logical :: ans
  character(len=3) :: first_result
  character(len=1) :: ch, c
  logical :: is_vowel

  ! Read N and the strings
  read(*,*) N
  do i = 1, N
     read(*,*) s(i)
  end do

  ! First part processing
  ans = .true.

  ! Check uniqueness do i = 1, N
     do j = 1, i-1
        if (trim(s(i)) == trim(s(j))) then
           ans = .false.
           exit
        end if
     end do
     if (.not. ans) exit
  end do

  ! If still ans is true, check the chain condition
  if (ans) then
     if (N >= 1) then
        ! Get last character of first string
        len_s = len_trim(s(1))
        ch = s(1)(len_s:len_s) do i = 2, N
           ! Check first character of current string matches previous last
           if (s(i)(1:1) /= ch) then
              ans = .false.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
exit
           end if
           ! Update ch to current's last character
           len_s = len_trim(s(i)) ch = s(i)(len_s:len_s)
        end do
     end if
  end if

  !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Determine first_result
  if (ans) then
     first_result = "Yes"
  else
     first_result = "No"
  end if

  ! Now process through second part
  ! Find last non-space or non-? character in first_result
  ch = ' '
  do i = len_trim(first_result), 1, -1
     c = first_result(i:i) if (c /= ' ' .and. c /= '?') then
        ch = c
        exit
     end if
  end do

  ! Convert to lowercase
  if (ichar(ch) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(ch) <= ichar('Z')) then
     ch = achar(ichar(ch) + 32)
  end if

  ! Check if vowel
  is_vowel = .false. select case(ch)
  case ('a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u', 'y')
     is_vowel = .true.
  end select

  !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Output
  if (is_vowel) then
     print *, "YES"
  else
     print *, "NO"
  end if

end program main

Okay, I need to translate these two Java programs into a single Fortran program that does the same thing as running them in sequence. Let me start by understanding what each Java program does.

First, the first Java program (atcoder_ABC109_B) reads N strings. It checks two conditions: all the strings must be unique, and each subsequent string must start with the last character of the previous one. If both conditions are met, it outputs "Yes"; else, "No".

The second Java program (codeforces_49_A) reads a string and checks if the last non-space or non-question mark character is a vowel (case-insensitive). If yes, outputs "YES", else "NO".

Now, the key is that the output of the first program is the input to the second. So when we run them in sequence, the first's output ("Yes" or "No") is the input for the second program. The second then processes that string.

Wait, but the second program expects a string input. So the first program's output is either "Yes" or "No", which is then the input for the second. The second program will check the last character (ignoring spaces and ?) of that input. Let me see:

Suppose first outputs "Yes". The second program will look for the last non-space or ? character. Since "Yes" has no spaces or ?, the last character is 's'. Then check if 's' is a vowel. 's' is not a vowel, so the second would output "NO".

If first outputs "No", then the last character is 'o', which is a vowel. So the second would output "YES".

Wait, let me confirm:

For "Yes":
The last character is 's', which is not a vowel. So second program would output "NO".

For "No":
The last character is 'o', which is a vowel. So second outputs "YES".

Therefore, the combined program's output depends on the first's result. So the final Fortran program must first process the input as per the first Java program, then take its result (Yes/No) and process it as per the second Java program.

Now, translating this into Fortran.

First, the Fortran program must read the input (from the first Java program's input), process the first part, then process the second part on the result of the first, and output the final result.

1. Read N and the N strings (from input).

So code outline:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: N, i, j, len_s, found, vowel
  character(len=100) :: s(1000)
  logical :: ans
  character(len=3) :: first_result
  character(len=1) :: ch, c
  logical :: is_vowel

  ! Read N and the strings
  read(*,*) N
  do i = 1, N
     read(*,*) s(i)
  end do

  ! First part processing
  ans = .true.

  ! Check uniqueness
  do i = 1, N
     do j = 1, i-1
        if (trim(s(i)) == trim(s(j))) then
           ans = .false.
           exit
        end if
     end do
     if (.not. ans) exit
  end do

  ! If still ans is true, check the chain condition
  if (ans) then
     if (N >= 1) then
        ! Get last character of first string
        len_s = len_trim(s(1))
        ch = s(1)(len_s:len_s)
        do i = 2, N
           ! Check first character of current string matches previous last
           if (s(i)(1:1) /= ch) then
              ans = .false.
              exit
           end if
           ! Update ch to current's last character
           len_s = len_trim(s(i))
           ch = s(i)(len_s:len_s)
        end do
     end if
  end if

  ! Determine first_result
  if (ans) then
     first_result = "Yes"
  else
     first_result = "No"
  end if

  ! Now process through second part
  ! Find last non-space or non-? character in first_result
  ch = ' '
  do i = len_trim(first_result), 1, -1
     c = first_result(i:i)
     if (c /= ' ' .and. c /= '?') then
        ch = c
        exit
     end if
  end do

  ! Convert to lowercase
  if (ichar(ch) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(ch) <= ichar('Z')) then
     ch = achar(ichar(ch) + 32)
  end if

  ! Check if vowel
  is_vowel = .false.
  select case(ch)
  case ('a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u', 'y')
     is_vowel = .true.
  end select

  ! Output
  if (is_vowel) then
     print *, "YES"
  else
     print *, "NO"
  end if

end program main
